qas.question: On what date did NATO kill Gaddafi's son?
At the time of these events, what was Robert Gates' title?
What city did NATO bomb on 25 April?

context: A week after the implementation of the no-fly zone, NATO announced that it would be enforced. On <a0_0>30 April<a0_0/> a <a1_0>NATO<a1_0/> airstrike killed Gaddafi's sixth son and three of his grandsons in Tripoli, though Gaddafi and his wife were unharmed. Western officials remained divided over whether Gaddafi was a legitimate military target under the U.N. Security Council resolution. U.S. <a2_0>Secretary of Defense<a2_0/> Robert Gates said that NATO was "not targeting Gaddafi specifically" but that his command-and-control facilities were legitimate targets—including a facility inside his sprawling <a3_0>Tripoli<a3_0/> compound that was hit with airstrikes on 25 April.
